title: Supervise small lorry and minibus learner drivers

details.overview: Teach or supervise C1 and D1 learner drivers - new rules for pre-1997 licence holders
details.body:
To supervise a learner in a minibus (class D1) or small truck (class C1) you must follow certain rules depending on when you got your licence.

What you must do

Licence issue date Before you can supervise or teach
Before 1 January 1997 You must pass the driving theory and practical driving tests for the category of vehicle being driven by the learner.
1 January 1997 to 30 April 2010 You can teach or supervise now, as your licence allows you to drive C1 and D1 vehicles.
From 1 May 2010 You can’t teach or supervise until you’ve held your licence for 3 years.
